lead_paragraph: A new exhibition is devoted to work by an 18th-century calligrapher who specialized in micrography — handwriting so small it’s barely legible to the naked eye.

headline.main: Ricky Jay and the Met Conjure Big Magic in Miniature

snippet: A new exhibition is devoted to work by an 18th-century calligrapher who specialized in micrography — handwriting so small it’s barely legible to the naked eye.
abstract: Magician Ricky Jay's book Matthias Buchinger: The Greatest German Living explores his fascination with the 18th-century German calligrapher, who was born without hands or feet and grew to only 29 inches tall; Jay has also lent his private collection of Buchinger memorabilia and drawings to Metropolitan Museum of Art for upcoming exhibit.
